definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: I would knock the door, but you might be scared.
sentences.chinese: 我想叩門，卻怕你被我嚇着。

sentences.english: Sue was upstairs measuring for blinds when I heard a rap at the door.
sentences.chinese: 蘇在樓上測量尺寸，好裝窗簾，我聽到叩門聲。

sentences.english: I can already hear it knocking.
sentences.chinese: 我已經聽到了新世界的叩門聲。

sentences.english: In something under half an hour there was a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 過了半小時不到一些，聽到一下叩門聲。

sentences.english: Behold I stand at the door and knock.
Here I am! I stand at the door and knock.
The sound of light rapping on the door pulled him out of his daze.
sentences.chinese: 輕叩門的聲音把他從幻想中拉回來。

sentences.english: that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
sentences.chinese: 他來到叩門，就立刻給他開門。

sentences.english: I stand at the door and knock.
I've seen that the new world is coming.
sentences.chinese: 我已經聽到了新世界的叩門聲。

sentences.english: Pressing lidless eyes and waiting for a knock upon the door.
sentences.chinese: 揉了難合的眼，等着叩門的一聲響。

sentences.english: He heard someone knocking lightly on the door.

definition: joint signatures (on a letter or declaration)
to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
initial/arising first/same as 首先發起|首先发起
